freak.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: someone who is extremely interested in a particular subject so that other people think they are strange or unusual
freak.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: someone who is considered to be very strange because of the way they look, behave, or think
freak.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: These glasses make me look like a freak.
Women who studied engineering used to be considered freaks.
freak.translation[0].definitions[2].defi: something in nature that is very unusual
freak.translation[0].definitions[2].exam: Due to some freak of nature, it snowed in June.
freak.translation[0].definitions[3].defi: an unexpected and very unusual event
freak.translation[0].definitions[3].exam: By some freak of fate, he walked away from the crash completely unhurt.
Aprilâ€™s sales figures were a freak.
freak.translation[1].definitions[0].exam: He was crushed to death in a freak accident.
The men drowned when a freak wave sank their boat.
freak.translation[2].definitions[0].defi: to become suddenly angry or afraid, especially so that you cannot control your behaviour
freak.translation[2].definitions[0].exam: When Ben heard about the accident, he just freaked.
